monogr.title: The comparation of a vyrgin and a martyr
monogr.author: Erasmus, Desiderius

div.head: ¶The preface. ¶To the ryght worshypfull Master Iohn Ramsay, lorde priour of Merton, Thomas Paynell, chanon of Merton sendeth gretynge.
div.p: THis lyttell and fruitfull boke, as you of your moste gentylle nature, desyred me your obedient, I haue translated into englyshe, I feare some wyll say, moche more gladly than counnyngly, and that my wyll was farre more redy thā my wytte: but howe soo euer I haue done, if it may please your lordshyp, I holde me well payde: for not only in this, but in all other thinges, my desyre is, to do that, that may be acceptable to your good mynde: other that be lerned, & lyke not my trāslation, may sette it forthe in englyshe more eloquently, and so do bothe great profyte and pleasure to many one.
Thus god preserue your lordshyp in good helthe.
